doc:
Lloyd Bacon https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lloyd_Bacon 0 Lloyd Francis Bacon (December 4, 1889 – November 15, 1955) was an American screen, stage and vaudeville actor and film director. As a director he made films in virtually all genres, including westerns, musicals, comedies, gangster films, and crime dramas. He was one of the directors at Warner Bros. in the 1930s who helped give that studio its reputation for gritty, fast-paced "torn from the headlines" action films. And, in directing Warner Bros.' 42nd Street, he joined the movie's song-and-dance-number director, Busby Berkeley, in contributing to "an instant and enduring classic [that] transformed the musical genre." Lloyd_Francis_Bacon ( December_4_,_1889 – November_15_,_1955 ) was an_American_screen_,_stage_and_vaudeville_actor_and_film_director . As a_director he made films in virtually_all_genres , including westerns , musicals , comedies , gangster_films , and crime_dramas . He was one of the_directors at Warner_Bros. in the_1930s who helped_give that_studio its_reputation for gritty_,_fast-paced_" torn from the_headlines_"_action_films . And , in directing Warner_Bros. '_42nd_Street , he joined the_movie 's_song-and-dance-number_director , Busby_Berkeley , in contributing_to_" an_instant_and_enduring_classic_[ that ] transformed the_musical_genre .
